page.title: 19 Itchen Bridge
page.content: On the first of June 1977,the long awaited fixed crossing between Chapel and Woolston was opened,and on the 13th July 1977, was officially named "Itchen bridge" by H.R.H. Princess Alexandria.The bridge is half a mile long.It costs 20p to cross over at off peak and 30p at peak hours (from 5 to 6 in the evening) for cars,and cuts the journey by 4 miles from Woolston to the city-centre in Southampton. This area mainly consists of public houses,warehouses and works. The River Itchen itself is green,muddy water.There is a major developement scheme for the area underneath the Itchen Bride. People's views: Many people say that the the roads need reconditioning.
